source.title: Non-UK domiciled spouse exemption cap
source.rationale: HMRC manual references non-dom spouse cap but no worked calculation example found. This is important for international estates and mixed-domicile couples.

testCase.description: Spouse exemption capped at NRB for non-UK domiciled spouse (no election made)
testCase.scenario: UK-domiciled deceased leaves £500,000 to non-UK domiciled spouse. No election made under IHTA 1984 s.267ZA. Spouse exemption is capped at the nil-rate band (£325,000), with excess being taxable.

warnings.message: Spouse exemption capped at £325,000 due to non-UK domicile. Consider making an election under IHTA 1984 s.267ZA to access unlimited exemption.

calculationNotes: For non-UK domiciled spouse without election:
NRB already used by the capped exemption: £325,000
Alternative: If election made under s.267ZA
- But spouse's worldwide assets then subject to UK IHT
Warning message should alert executor to election option
hmrcQuote: N/A - Synthetic case. Based on IHTA 1984 s.18 which limits spouse exemption to the nil-rate band where the spouse is not domiciled in the UK, unless an election is made under s.267ZA to treat the spouse as UK domiciled.
